name: Data Science Part Time Course
body:
Course Repository

Course materials for [General Assembly's Data Science course](https://generalassemb.ly/education/data-science/Sydney/) **Location:** Level M, 56-58 York St Sydney NSW 2000 **Dates:** 21/03/2016 - 01/06/2016 **Instructors:** Ian Hansel **Teaching Assistant:** Matt Gibson ##Schedule Monday | Wednesday --- | --- 21/03: [Introduction](#class-1-introduction) | 23/03: [Basics](#class-2-basics) 28/03: Easter Break | 30/03: [Data Visualisation](#class-3-data-visualisation) 04/04: [Linear Regression](#class-4-linear-regression) | 06/04: [Logistic Regression](#class-5-logistic-regression) 11/04: [Model Evaluation](#class-6-model-evaluation) | 13/04: [Regularisation](#class-7-regularisation) 18/04: [Clustering](#class-8-clustering) | 20/04: [Recommendation Engines](#class-9-recommendation-engines) 25/04: Anzac Day | 27/04: [Dimensionality Reduction](#class-10-dimensionality-reduction) 02/05: [Decision Trees](#class-11-decision-trees) | 04/05: [Random Forests & Ensembling](#class-12-random-forests-and-ensembling) 09/05: [Cloud Computing](#class-13-cloud-computing) | 11/05: [Natural Language Processing](#class-14-natural-language-processing) 16/05: [Time Series](#class-15-timeseries) | 18/05: [Communication](#class-16-communication) 23/05: [Graphs & Network Analysis](#class-17-graphs-and-network-analysis) | 25/05: [Neural Networks & Deep Learning](#class-18-neural-networks-and-deep-learning) 30/05: [Course Review & Project Presentations](#class-19-course-review) | 01/06: [Project Presentations](#class-20-where-to-now-?) --- ## Pre-Work ### Installation and Setup * Install the [Anaconda distribution](http://continuum.io/downloads) of Python 2.7x. * Install [Git](http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Getting-Started-Installing-Git) and create a [GitHub](https://github.com/) account. * Once you receive an email invitation from [Slack](https://slack.com/), join our "SYD\_DAT\_4 team" and add your photo! ### Resources * [PEP 8 - Style Guide for Python](http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008) ### Readings * Read the first two chapters of [The Data Science Handbook](http://www.thedatasciencehandbook.com/) * Read the first two chapters of an [Introduction to Statistical Learning][http://www-bcf.usc.edu/~gareth/ISL/ISLR%20Fourth%20Printing.pdf] ### Optional You're also more than welcome to do the following if you're keen to get extra advanced for your first class: * [Python Codecademy course](https://www.codecademy.com/learn/python) * Chapters 1, 2 and 5 of [Python for Data Analysis](http://shop.oreilly.com/product/0636920023784.do) * [Learn Python the Hard Way](www.learnpythonthehardway.org ) * [Command Line Crash Course](http://cli.learncodethehardway.org/book/) * [Khan Academy on Probability](https://www.khanacademy.org/math/probability) --- ##Course Project Information The final project should represent significant original work applying data science techniques to an interesting problem. Final projects are individual attainments, but you should be talking frequently with your instructors and classmates about them. Address a data-related problem in your professional field or a field you're interested in. Pick a subject that you're passionate about; if you're strongly interested in the subject matter it'll be more fun for you and you'll produce a better project! Look at [past projects](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/tree/master/project-examples) on github for some ideas. --- ## Class 1: Introduction * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%201%20-%20Monday%20Monday%2021%20March.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%201/00_python_refresher.py) * Introduction to General Assembly * Course overview: our philosophy and expectations * Tools: check for proper setup of Git, Anaconda, overview of Slack **Homework:** * Resolve any installation issues before next class. * Make sure you have a github profile and created a repo called "SYD_DAT_4" * Clone the class repo (this one!) **Optional:** * Read [Analyzing the Analyzers](http://cdn.oreillystatic.com/oreilly/radarreport/0636920029014/Analyzing_the_Analyzers.pdf) for a useful look at the different types of data scientists. * Read about [Markdown Techniques](http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/syntax) ## Class 2: Basics * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%201%20-%20Wednesday%2023%20March.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%201%20-%20Wednesday%2023%20March%20Git.pdf) * Running Jupyter notebooks Pandas * Data Manipulation in Python * Know how to submit homework (more git skills) **Extra Reading:** * Here's the airbnb blog I mentioned tonight http://nerds.airbnb.com/scaling-data-science/ ## Class 3: Data Visualisation * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%202%20-%20Wednesday%2030%20March.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%202/Lab%202%20-%20Data%20Visualisation.ipynb) * Understand the goals of data visualisation * Visualise a data set * Understand different graph types and when to use them **Extra Reading:** * http://www.theguardian.com/news/datablog/interactive/2014/apr/15/australia-football-interactive-statistics * http://www.sbs.com.au/news/map/where-australias-immigrants-were-born-sydney * http://small.mu/work * The Largest Ever Analysis of Film Dialogue by Gender: 2,000 scripts, 25,000 actors, 4 million lines http://polygraph.cool/films/index.html * http://graphics.latimes.com/kobe-every-shot-ever/ * https://twitter.com/upshotnyt/status/721738264022020096 * Things to think of later for choosing colours in a graph http://lisacharlotterost.github.io/2016/04/22/Colors-for-DataVis/ * http://flowingdata.com/2016/04/27/global-shipping-in-a-narrated-interactive-map/ ## Class 4: Linear Regression * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%203%20-%20Monday%204%20April.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%203/Lab%203%20-%20Regression.ipynb) * Understand the differences between supervised and unsupervised learning * Describe the process of building a linear regression model * Build a linear regression model and interpret the output **Homework:** * ## Class 5: Logistic Regression * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%203%20-%20Wednesday%206%20April.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%203/Logistic_regression.ipynb) * Understand when to use logistic regression and how the model is created * How logistic regression differs from linear regression * Build a logistic regression model and interpret the output * Evaluate a logistic regression model ## Class 6: Model Evaluation * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%204%20-%20Monday%2011%20April.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%204/Monday%20April%2011%20model_evaluation.ipynb) * Understand the importance of properly evaluating a model * Explain Bias-Variance tradeoff * Explain the basics of Cross-Validation * Use Cross-Validation when building a model ## Class 7: Regularisation * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%204%20-%20Wednesday%2013%20April.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%204/Wednesday%20April%2013%20-%20Regularization.ipynb) * Select variables for a regression model * Know methods to automatically select variables for a model * Explain the difference between Ridge regression and Lasso Regression * Tie together the concepts of Regression models, bias-variance trade-off, and Cross Validation ## Class 8: Clustering * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%205%20-%20Monday%2018%20April.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%205/Wednesday%2013%20January%202016.ipynb) * Review unsupervised learning * Understand the k-means algorithm * Know if a cluster is a good fit * Summarise a cluster ## Class 9: Recommendation Engines * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%205%20-%20Wednesday%2020%20April.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%205/Wednesday%20April%2020%202016%20-%20Recommendations.ipynb) * Know 2 different methods for giving recommendations * Evaluate recommendation performance * Extract extra information from the recommendation engine ## Class 10: Dimensionality Reduction * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%206%20-%20Wednesday%2027%20April.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%206/Wednesday%2027%20April%20-%20PCA.ipynb) * Know what dimensionality reduction is and when to apply it * Explain Principal Component Analysis * Explain Singular Value Decomposition ## Class 11: Decision Trees * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%207%20-%20Monday%202%20May.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%207/Monday%20May%202%20-%20Decision%20Trees.ipynb) * Know the advantages and disadvantages of a decision tree * Understand how a decision tree decides on the split to make ## Class 12: Random Forests and Ensembling * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%207%20-%20Wednesday%204%20May.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%207/Wednesday%20May%204-ensembling.ipynb) * Explain Ensemble learning * Explain Bagging * Explain Random Forests * Explain Boosting * Run through a Random Forest model and evaluate ## Class 13: Cloud Computing * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%208%20-%20Monday%209%20May.pdf) * Explain what Spark is * Be able to setup a spark cluster * Run a Spark job through Zepplin ## Class 14: Natural Language Processing * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%208%20-%20Wednesday%2011%20May.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%208/Natural%20Language%20Proessing.ipynb) * Explain the main concepts in Natural Language Processing * Understand how Sentiment Analysis works * Be able to perform the preprocessing steps for NLP ## Class 15: Time Series * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%209%20-%20Monday%2016%20May.pdf) * Explain what a time series is * Why it need different treatment * Know how to decompose a time series * Know what an ARIMA model is * Know what an exponential model is * Know how to evaluate a time series model * Learn enough R to be dangerous ## Class 16: Communication * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%209%20-%20Wednesday%2018%20May.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%209/Less%20Technical.ipynb) * What makes for good data science communication * How to present results * Some approaches to networking with people in the industry * What to expect in a data science interview ## Class 17: Graphs and Network Analysis * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%2010%20-%20Monday%2023%20May.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%2010/Network%20Analysis.ipynb) * Explain the main concepts in Network Analysis * Understand the applications of network analysis * Explain, centrality, communities, edges and nodes ## Class 18: Neural Network Analysis and Deep Learning * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%2010%20-%20Wednesday%2025%20May.pdf) * [Lab](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/labs/Week%2010/Neural%20Networks.ipynb) * Explain what a Neural Network is * Why the resurgence in popularity? * Understand the applications on Neural Networks * Run a NN in Tensorflow ## Class 19: Course Review * [Slides](https://github.com/ihansel/SYD_DAT_4/blob/master/slides/Data%20Science%20Week%2011%20-%20Monday%2030%20May.pdf) --- ## Where to now?
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
